data.text:
Actress and filmmaker Melissa Fumero hails from the United States. Melissa Fumero is best known for her role as Amy Santiago on “Brooklyn Nine-Nine,” an American police sitcom.

Melissa Fumero has also been a series regular since 2013, and in the 2019 season 6 episode, “The Return of the King,” she made her directorial debut. For her work on the show, she also received an NHMC Impact Award.

What is Melissa Fumero’s Net Worth? Salary, Earnings

She has reaped substantial rewards from her careers as an actress and director. In the 16 years since she began acting, she has advanced to become one of the most well-known actresses.

No doubt, he makes money from his movies, TV shows, and social media channels. Also, as of February 2023, his total net worth including earnings is predicted to be around $4 million.

Where was Melissa Fumero born? Ethnicity, Nationality, Family, Education

Melissa Fumero was born on August 19, 1982 in North Bergen, New Jersey. Melissa Gallo is her real name. She is a resident of the United States. Melissa Fumero is a mixed-race woman and was born under the sign of Leo. She has Cuban ancestry. She is 39 years old.

Also, Carlos and Martha Gallo were the parents of the child (father). Her father was an archaeologist and her mother had previously worked as a tour guide. Melissa Fumero’s parents settled in the United States after arriving as teenagers from Cuba. Her sisters are Julia and Julia Gallo and she has siblings named Maximillian and Johanna Gallo.

Her family moved to Lyndhurst, New Jersey when she was six, leaving Guttenberg, New Jersey. She has always loved dancing and has taken several different dance classes since she was a child.

Lyndhurst High School was her top choice for a school. She continued her education at New York University, where in 2003 she earned a Bachelor of Fine Arts in theater. She then decided to pursue acting as a career.

Is Melissa Fumero married? Relationship

Melissa Fumero is a woman who has been married, but to only one man. She co-starred in the television series “One Life to Live” with David Fumero, and the two were married on December 9, 2007.

Two children have already been born to the happy couple. Axel was born on February 14, 2020, and Enzo, their second son, was born on March 14, 2016. The couple currently lives in Los Angeles, California.

How tall is Melissa Fumero? Weight, Hair color

Melissa Fumero is a beautiful woman in her 30s with an hourglass figure. She is 5 feet 9 inches (1.75 meters) tall and weighs around 62 kilograms (137 lbs). Her body measurements are 34-23-34 inches and she wears a bra size of 34B, a dress size of 4 (US), and a shoe size of 8 (US). She has brown eyes, black hair, and a fair complexion.

How did Melissa Fumero begin her professional career?

After 208 episodes and 208 appearances, Melissa Fumero left the American soap opera “One Life to Live” in 2011. She made her acting debut in 2004 as Adriana Cramer.

In the 2007 American thriller Descent, she played Dorm Girl #2; Similarly, in the 2009 American independent comedy I Hope They Serve Beer in Hell, she played Melissa; and in the same year, she played Ati in the film Tiny Dancer and Jo in the 11-episode web series Haute & Bothered.

All My Children, Important Things with Demetri Martin, Match Game, Room 104, Mourners, Inc., Once Day at a Time, The Mentalist, Royal Pains, Men at Work, Top Chef Duels, Mack & Moxy, and The $100,000 Pyramid are just a few of the shows and series he has guest-starred on.

Her career took off in 2013 when she was cast as Amy Santiago, the lead character, in the American police sitcom television series “Brooklyn Nine-Nine”, for which she received three Imagen Award nominations and an NHMC Award.

She has appeared in 153 episodes of “Brooklyn Nine-Nine,” made her directorial debut in 2019 with the Season 6 episode “Return of the King” and will reprise her role as Amy Santiago in the show’s final season, which is set to premiere August 12, 2021.

Melissa Fumero has voiced “Elena of Avalor,” “Big City Greens,” “She-Ra and the Princesses of Power,” and “MODOK” among animated series. She has appeared in two short films, “Half Empty” and “Stolen Hearts,” and in 2019, she appeared in an episode of “America’s Got Talent: The Champions.”
